page.title: 18By train down to the Quay.
page.content: The {train}takes passengers from {Weymouth Station}to the{Ferry Terminal on the{Quay side.}When the train goes {through Weymouth}it can cause a big traffic jam, especially if the train is a long one because it blocks several main traffic routes.The train leaves the station, past the fair, along{Commercial Road down to the Quay {side.}Infront of the Train is a {police car.}Behind the police car, infront of the train are{two men in {florescent jackets who carry red {flags.}Sometimes when the train comes through some cars are parked in the way so the police and men have to move them by force. This can cause the train to be late by the Quay side.Most visitors think it is funny that the train goes through a busy part of Weymouth,{usually twice a day}to link with the ferry. -Pam Whitmarsh.
